title: Silent Lines, Russell Maliphant Dance Company, Sadler’s Wells, review: like watching flesh-and-blood CGI
text:
It has been said that the greatest film directors spend their entire careers remaking the same movie: Spielberg’s repeated tales of implacable, insatiable evil; Hitchcock’s obsessive variations on “the wrong man” scenario; Scorsese’s endless mining of his Little Italy roots.

The same could be said of some of the greatest choreographers, not least Russell Maliphant. Ever since founding his own company in 1996, the former Royal Ballet School hotshot has essentially been doing one thing: investigating, time and again, the infinite possibilities of bodies moving through light. His style – a complex and completely seamless interweaving of classical rigour, capoeira, T’ai-chi and more – is as unique...
